pageContent: Introduction: Prostate cancer is the most common type of cancer found in American men. Patient adjustment to prostate cancer is not limited to attempts to restore sexual function, a process that can pose significant challenges to couples following most surgical and nonsurgical treatments. Patients often struggle with depression and other relational stressors. Partners also undergo psychosocial, relational, sexual, and quality-of-life changes and their responses to these changes may relate to patient adjustment.

metaData.source:
Current management of erectile dysfunction after cancer treatment
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19509501/
